question: Question_07_(a)
sols:
The formula for the trapezoidal approximation of the integral is as
follows:

\[T_4 = \frac{\Delta x}{2} (f(x_0) + 2f(x_1)  + 2f(x_2) + 2f(x_3) + f(x_4))\]

The \emph{4} of $T_4$ means that our interval of integration has been
divided into four pieces, each of length \emph{(b-a)/4=1/4}. So
$\Delta x = 1/4$. We also know that $x_0$ and $x_4$ are the endpoints of
the interval of integration. So we have

\begin{align*}
x_0 &= 1 \\
x_1&= 5/4 \\
x_2 &= 6/4 \\
x_3 &= 7/4 \\
x_4 &= 2 \\
\end{align*}

We simply plug this all into the formula given above to get:

\[T_4 = \frac18 \left(\frac1{1} + 2 \frac1{5/4}  + 2 \frac1{6/4} + 2 \frac1{7/4} + \frac1{2}) \right)\]
hints:
The general formula for the trapezoidal approximation $T_n$ is given by:

$T_n = \frac{\Delta x}{2} (f(x_0) + 2f(x_1) + \dots + 2f(x_{n-1}) + f(x_n))$

What are $x_0$ and $x_n$?
